snippet: Time is running short for a new team to sign an accord with the Bloomberg administration that would involve tax breaks, public land and public financing.
abstract: Owner of New York's new professional soccer team and Bloomberg administration are nearing tentative agreement to build city's first soccer-only venue; deal for New York City Football Club, partnership between Manchester City Football Club of England and the Yankees, to play in $350 million, 28,000-seat stadium in the Bronx may be signed before Mayor-elect Bill de Blasio takes office.
lead_paragraph: Time is running short for a new team to sign an accord with the Bloomberg administration that would involve tax breaks, public land and public financing.

headline.main: Deal for Bronx Soccer Stadium in Works as Clock Ticks
headline.print_headline: Soccer Team and City May Sign Stadium Deal Before de Blasio Takes Office

keywords.value: New York City Football Club (Soccer Team)
keywords.name: organizations
